content.html:
Could SetLinearAccel be made to work by setting the force on the link?

this->SetForce(this->inertial->Mass() * _accel);

pullrequest.title: Remove two members in Link that are never really used and are confusing

content.html:
I think the formula in WorldAngularAccel() can be rewritten as I * a + w x L

this->SetTorque(this->WorldInertiaMatrix() * _accel + this->WorldAngularVel().Cross(this->WorldAngularMomentum()));

pullrequest.title: Remove two members in Link that are never really used and are confusing

content.raw:
Hi  @JenniferBuehler , thanks for the PR, we are in real need for more efforts to clean the physics API.

I haven't thought much about the whole pull request yet, but I'll leave some comments here for now:

1. These functions are public and the headers are installed, so users could be using them. This means we need to deprecate them before removing. We follow the [tick-tock](http://gazebosim.org/#status) release cycle, so we deprecate for one major release and remove the functions on the next major release. So in the very least, they need to be deprecated for Gazebo 9 and this should be documented in the `Migration.md` guide.

1. I agree that these variables look like they're not useful. But only checking within the Gazebo source code is not enough indication that they're not used at all. User code could potentially be inheriting from the `Link` class and making use of these protected variables.
content.html:
Hi @JenniferBuehler , thanks for the PR, we are in real need for more efforts to clean the physics API.

I haven't thought much about the whole pull request yet, but I'll leave some comments here for now:

  1. These functions are public and the headers are installed, so users could be using them. This means we need to deprecate them before removing. We follow the tick-tock release cycle, so we deprecate for one major release and remove the functions on the next major release. So in the very least, they need to be deprecated for Gazebo 9 and this should be documented in the Migration.md guide.

  2. I agree that these variables look like they're not useful. But only checking within the Gazebo source code is not enough indication that they're not used at all. User code could potentially be inheriting from the Link class and making use of these protected variables.

pullrequest.title: Remove two members in Link that are never really used and are confusing

content.raw:
That is a fair point! Though only users who derive from Link could potentially make use of it, as there is no getters for those variables. People using the public accessors may have already noticed that it doesn't have an effect to use the functions...

I agree that deprecating the functions first would be a better way to go. I haven't thought about users deriving from Link... it's probably easier for them to re-implement the simple functionality in their derived Link class though, but they will notice the removed functionality with the deprecation as well - one might hope they look at the warnings.

If we deprecate the functions, would it be OK to just print a warning and remove the actual functionality, i.e. just leave the function signatures but remove the variables? Or better we leave everything as is and just add deprecation?
content.html:
That is a fair point! Though only users who derive from Link could potentially make use of it, as there is no getters for those variables. People using the public accessors may have already noticed that it doesn't have an effect to use the functions...

I agree that deprecating the functions first would be a better way to go. I haven't thought about users deriving from Link... it's probably easier for them to re-implement the simple functionality in their derived Link class though, but they will notice the removed functionality with the deprecation as well - one might hope they look at the warnings.

If we deprecate the functions, would it be OK to just print a warning and remove the actual functionality, i.e. just leave the function signatures but remove the variables? Or better we leave everything as is and just add deprecation?

pullrequest.title: Remove two members in Link that are never really used and are confusing

content.raw: I would vote for deprecating the functions on gazebo9 and only removing the functions and protected variables on gazebo10. The reasoning is that we give users one release cycle to adapt their code in case they're making use of the protected variables. But we've broken this kind of reasoning before...
content.html: I would vote for deprecating the functions on gazebo9 and only removing the functions and protected variables on gazebo10. The reasoning is that we give users one release cycle to adapt their code in case they're making use of the protected variables. But we've broken this kind of reasoning before...

pullrequest.title: Remove two members in Link that are never really used and are confusing

content.raw:
Ok, sounds reasonable. Suppose the only argument for the radical removal approach is that the functions/variables don't do anything and seem a bit out of place... though one never knows if somebody may be using them anyway, and I totally see the point to give users one cycle to adjust their code. That makes sense and it's a sensible policy to have.

If you like I can make a PR with the deprecations. Or because it's such a tiny change you maybe prefer to just quickly do it yourself? Just let me know. We can then close this PR and re-submit this cleanup PR in a year or so.
content.html:
Ok, sounds reasonable. Suppose the only argument for the radical removal approach is that the functions/variables don't do anything and seem a bit out of place... though one never knows if somebody may be using them anyway, and I totally see the point to give users one cycle to adjust their code. That makes sense and it's a sensible policy to have.

If you like I can make a PR with the deprecations. Or because it's such a tiny change you maybe prefer to just quickly do it yourself? Just let me know. We can then close this PR and re-submit this cleanup PR in a year or so.

pullrequest.title: Remove two members in Link that are never really used and are confusing

content.raw:
So I've been thinking more about this and I'm ok with deprecating these functions if other reviewers are too. There's no point on keeping useless API around, if someone is using it, they will have a cycle to  implement their own functions, which as you said, is not a lot of work.

I'll approve it if you make the changes :) Let me know if you need any guidance on doing the deprecations, it's basically just appending `GAZEBO_DEPRECATED(9.0)` to the function prototypes and adding explanation to the migration guide. Thanks!
content.html:
So I've been thinking more about this and I'm ok with deprecating these functions if other reviewers are too. There's no point on keeping useless API around, if someone is using it, they will have a cycle to implement their own functions, which as you said, is not a lot of work.

I'll approve it if you make the changes :) Let me know if you need any guidance on doing the deprecations, it's basically just appending GAZEBO_DEPRECATED(9.0) to the function prototypes and adding explanation to the migration guide. Thanks!
